data.title: Fix font size (when font is italic) in ProjectExtensionsDialog
data.body:
Fix font size (when font is italic) in ProjectExtensionsDialog.
(Use System-based font (DEFAULT_GUI_FONT) in wxSmith instead of Custom font)

data.title: New Start Here Page
data.body: A wxCrafter project is also now available for GDIDE.

data.title: Added the Event Store, which offers event templates shared on GDevApp.com
Object editor improvements [Test, don't merge it]
data.body:
Here is some improvements to the object editor (and the object selection dialog).
If you can test it and tell me what do you think of these improvements ? (not finished yet, it's just some ideas)

List of improvements : 
- Separate groups from objects
- Global objects/groups are shown in bold
- Edit groups directly from the object editor : you can unfold a group to see the objects inside
- Drag an object into a group to add it to the group
- Quick group creation : Drag an object on "Groups" (will show "Create a new group") and GDevelop will create a new group with this object inside.

data.title: Improve installDeps.sh
data.body:
Put all package in a single command line.
Force the output filename (for downloads) to avoid problems when using the script multiple times.
Fixes for wxWidgets 3.0.2

data.title: fixing "LGPL" typo
data.body: just a minor typo in the readme file.

data.title: Would you consider licensing also under MIT license?
data.body: See this discussion of LGPL vs MIT licensing: http://programmers.stackexchange.com/questions/81947/why-is-jquery-released-under-mit-and-not-lgpl

data.title: what is LPGL license?
data.body: Your readme says " LPGL v3 license" but isn't that really "LGPL v3 license?"

data.title: TileMapObject : Condition to test if an object is on a tile (without the tile hitbox)
data.body:
TileMapObject : Condition to test if an object is on a tile (without the tile hitbox)
Allows to test if an object is over an empty tile for example.

data.title: Bugs in InstructionSelector
data.body:
There are some problems with the new InstructionSelector window : 
- The window is too small (can't see more than 2 parameters before manually resizing it)
- The Tree control's width is too small too.
- Selecting the edited condition/actions doesn't work (seems to work sometime, it was working better before this change) : should consider storing a map with actions' names and their TreeItemId.

data.title: Add offset to the layout grid
data.body:
Add offset to the layout grid.
(Can't update the translation as TranslationsUpdate.bat say that libgettextsrc-0-17.dll is missing)

data.title: Instruction selector refactoring
Actions/Conditions windows improvement
data.body: When editing a condition/action, the condition/action is automatically selected (and expanded) in the treectrl.

data.title: Add Undo/Redo and flood fill in TileMapObject
data.body: Add Undo/Redo and flood fill in the TileMapObject's editor.

data.title: Improvements for TileMapObject
data.body:
Here are some improvements for the TileMapObject : 
- Tiles changes doesn't need a full regeneration of the TileMap de1408f
- The selected tile ID is shown in the TileEditor (not in the TileSetPanel anymore) bbeeba2
- Fix a bug with mono bitmaps in the TileEditor (already fixed in Tile(Set/Map)Panel) 581f2a4 #46 

**Changes inside GDCore :** PolygonCollision tests ignores polygons with less than 3 vertices (as TileMapObject now have "empty" polygon for empty tiles) de1408f

data.title: Use wxWidgets 3.0.2 (under Linux)
data.body:
The second minor version of wxWidgets 3.0 has been released. It brings some bug fixes, so it's highly recommended to use it now for GDevelop.
It doesn't cause any problems to GDevelop as this version is fully compatible with the older one.

(We should still consider using this version under Windows, PR #3 is not mergeable anymore, but we can make another one just to switch wx version, without changing mingw)

data.title: TileMapObject : Black tiles in tile mask editor
data.body: Need to fix this bug (already fixed in the tilemap panel and in the tileset panel).

data.title: TileMapObject : Flood fill
data.body:
Add flood fill to the tilemap editor.

http://forum.compilgames.net/viewtopic.php?f=22&t=5702

data.title: TileMapObject : Condition to test collision with a tile ID
data.body:
This function will test if an object collides with a tile with a specific tile ID.
For example : test if a player hits a coin tile (without testing all tiles having a coin tile).

http://forum.compilgames.net/viewtopic.php?f=22&t=5713

data.title: Sprite Object Editor : Ok/Cancel buttons
data.body:
The sprite object editor doesn't have any of those buttons. It may be useful if you wants to cancel all the changes you've made. Also, it avoids GD to rely on the dialog close button (that's causing troubles on Gnome 3 because modal dialogs are fixed and without close buttons).
If a "Cancel" button is added, it means the editor will have to copy the data before changing it (currently, it directly changes the data on the sprite).

![capture d ecran de 2014-10-14 20 46 31](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/964512/4634675/7a413e36-53d2-11e4-9b1d-3855b21a525f.png)

data.title: Action to open a web page
data.body:
There should be an action to open a web page.
For HTML5 games, the action should trigger the opening of a new tab (using `window`).
For native games, the action should use the system standard way of opening links (a call to `system()` with `start` for Windows or `xdg-open` for Linux, as already done in another action (can't remember its name). Probably an alias to this action would be ok, no need to implement something specific in this case).

data.title: Action to lock screen orientation for HTML5 games
data.body:
There should be an action to lock the screen orientation. The implementation should test the device/engine it is running in (Intel XDK/CocoonJS/Crosswalk/Vanilla browser) and call the appropriate function if it exists.

http://www.forum.compilgames.net/viewtopic.php?f=19&t=5628

data.body:
(http://forum.compilgames.net/viewtopic.php?f=20&t=5111)
The bug seems to happen in gd::EventEditorSelection::EndDragInstruction : at the end, when GD is trying to show (in std::cout) the list events type moved.
If I remove that part, GD crash somewhere else...

data.body: Fix wrong help link for french translation.

data.title: NodeJS not found under Linux
data.body: GD seems to search for NodeJS in invalid standard path. In fact, NodeJS executable is not named node but nodejs.

data.title: Fix for shortcuts problems in wxGTK
data.body:
I think I've found a solution to fix the shortcuts in the event editor.
Currently, the EventsEditor is a wxPanel so it can't get the focus : so, on GTK, the key input is not received and is sent to another control (sometime the objects list of the project tree).
To allow the EventsEditor to gain the focus, it should inherit of wxControl instead of wxPanel.
I've tested it and it works ! :+1: 

This solution is easy to implement, you just have to change wxPanel to wxControl and add wxDefaultValidator before the last argument of the Create function.

data.title: Fix a bug with functions across scenes
data.body:
Fix a bug with functions across scenes.
The global vector currentFunctionParameters is now named using the scene mangled name to avoid multiple declaration around scenes.

Before merging : test if it works when an function is linked to another scene without events copy.

data.title: LayersEditorPanel generated by wxCrafter
data.body:
Here is the new LayersEditorPanel generated by wxCrafter.
I've also modified the CMakeLists.txt to exclude the wxCrafter generated files (GDCoreDialogs.cpp ...). I can't exclude the whole GDCore/IDE/Dialogs folder as some the files are used by the GDCore tests.

data.title: Fix polygons point not moving in SpriteObjectEdition
data.body:
Fix polygons point not moving in SpriteObjectEdition (only under wxGTK).
The polygon treeview seemed to get selection change events while being updated when moving a point : it causes the point to be unselected.
